alert.note: Alert for McCulloch (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 08 at 10:55PM CDT until May 08 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, McCulloch. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1052 PM CDT, radar indicated very heavy rain with a cluster of thunderstorms over central and southern McCulloch County, moving south at 20 mph. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches in a short period of time will cause minor flooding, especially in low-lying areas, and street flooding in Brady. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brady, Brady Lake, Rochelle, Lohn, Placid, Calf Creek and The Intersection Of Us-190 And Ranch Road 1311. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... South Blackburn between Adkins and 13th, White Street at Live Oak Creek, Hallum Draw, FM 1121 crossing Onion Creek, 17th Street between Pine and College, South High between 14th and 15th Streets, FM 1028 crossing Corn Creek, County Road 314 crossing East Fork Cow Creek, County Road 156 crossing Bowtie Creek and County Road 158 crossing Bowtie Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
